welcomeMessage: Ask me anything about living in Korea!

transportation.q1: How do I use the subway in Korea?
transportation.a1: You can use T-money card or credit card to pay for subway rides. Download the KakaoMetro app for route planning.
transportation.q2: How do I get a T-money card?
transportation.a2: You can buy T-money cards at convenience stores, subway stations, or online. The basic card costs 2,500-3,000 KRW.
transportation.q3: What are the subway operating hours?
transportation.a3: Subways usually operate from 5:30 AM to midnight. Some lines may have different schedules.

banking.q1: How do I open a bank account?
banking.a1: Visit a bank branch with your ARC and passport. Most banks require a minimum deposit of 1,000 KRW.
banking.a2: You need your Alien Registration Card (ARC), passport, and sometimes proof of address.
banking.q3: Can I use foreign credit cards?
banking.a3: Yes, most places accept foreign credit cards, but some small shops may only accept Korean cards.

footer.description: K-Life Assistant helps foreigners living in Korea with daily life questions and information.
